headline: Seven Layer Tex Mex Dip
description: This super seven layer dip is piled high with Mexican style goodies. Serve it with tortilla chips!
name: Seven Layer Tex Mex Dip

recipeInstructions.text: In a large serving dish, spread the refried beans. Layer the guacamole on top of the beans.
In a medium bowl, mix the mayonnaise, sour cream and taco seasoning mix. Spread over the layer of guacamole.
Sprinkle a layer of Cheddar cheese over the mayonnaise mixture layer. Sprinkle tomato, green onions and black olives over the cheese.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for Haystack 7-layer dip and this was the one - except omit the mayo - tostito's scoops are perfect to eat it. I made my own guac - 5 avocados, 1/3 cup fresh lime juice, 1/2 tsp onion, garlic, coriander powder, salt and pepper - 10 grinds of each. We brought to the Christmas party tonight and it was ALL GONE.
Delicious! Made it for a small girls' night and it was a huge hit. Only thing I changed was dropping the mayo and replacing it with cream cheese.
I made it without mayonnaise and increased the sour cream to compensate. My husband and I ate all of in one afternoon. We’re both pretty fat, but still. I highly recommend it!
Fast and easy recipe for Tex Mex layered dip. I just added a layer of salsa.
Great recipe - I omitted the mayo but otherwise made it exactly as written - a big hit at the Super Bowl party!

Awesome dip! My layers were: refried beans, spicy guacamole, sour cream mixture (1/4 cup cream cheese, 1 cup sour cream and the packaged taco mix), thin layer of cheddar cheese, cilantro, black olives and green onions. This was topped with more cheese and spoonfuls of salsa. Right before serving I squeezed lime juice on top. *I subbed the mayo w/cream cheese after reading multiple other reviews. Served with Tostidos Scoops and Fritos Scoops.
Delicious! I also added jalapenos to the top.
Everyone loved it!
made this for a picnic...have eaten many times first time making it. omitted the mayo and added cream cheese, added lettuce.
Wonderful party dish! I didn’t use mayonnaise but blended 8 oz cream cheese into beans & TASC seasoning for bottom layer
I followed the advice from other reviewers to leave out the mayo. It was very tasty, though next time I might go lighter on the taco seasoning.
Will definitely make it again I added a bit of salsa on top with the tomatoes
Absolutely loved this recipe!! Everyone ate up......so fast and I doubled the recipe!! Don't add Mayo though as it's perfect without it!
Easy recipe, and TASTES GREAT! This was a hit at out Christmas party tonight! Thanks for sharing!!
I have made this dip for years and it's gone when I leave a party! I add black beans to it with the refried beans.

I started making this simple little recipe probably about 5 or 6 years ago now, and it's become one of my signature dishes everyone asks for! I make it just like the recipe, with one small change. I started adding one more can of refried beans, and i spoon it in little dabs on top of the sour cream layer. When you spread it, it mixes slightly with the sour cream mix and makes it even more tasty, and also more filling!! Then I just top it with the cheese and veggies like normal! I can't tell you how many events I've made it for and its always the first thing to run out (which is why i bring two pans now!)

Great reviews from all the party goers.
I used rinsed black beans and seeded the tomatoes so the dip didn’t get soggy.
Awesome!!
This was actually really terrible. What a waste of ingredients.
No changes and yes, I would make again.

great dish! it was a hit with the whole family!! I will definitely make this again but not use mayo. I read the reviews before making the dish and a lot of people said the mayo was too strong so I made it with a small amount but it was still a bit off putting. So def a repeat dish but without the mayo.

This was very much like the Taco Dip recipe I had from about 20 years ago. Instead of the mayo I used 1/4 c. Ranch Dressing (the one I buy is a little thicker than most). It was delicious and a big hit at the party. I'll surely be making this again!

It was a hit at a gathering I attended. The taste was to die for!! I did give it a little twist by adding jalapeno garlic seasoning, 1/2 a lime juice squeezed and my favorite, cilantro! It was a KNOCK OUT!!
I made this and also left out the mayo. I also added green chilies to the top. It was a hit!
Easy to make, tasted great!
I make this all the time. Love it exactly as recipe is .
VERY good but how do you count lettuce... olives... and tomato's as layers??? YOU forgot to add salt/pepper and call it a 9 layer.

I give it a 5 star because it's a great dip. I made it a second time and changed up the types of layers which still came out great as I wanted a spicy dip... i.e. jalapeno refried beans, sliced jalapeno layers over the (spicy)guacamole, instead of sour cream I did a jalapeno nacho cheese spread, topped it with a can of spicy rotel in place of the tomatoe and minced up jalapeno instead of the grean onion on top.... with all the jalapeno added it was not as spicy as it would seem it was a nice kick and everyone loved it :)
Very good, I take it to parties regularly.

Double and added soft cream cheese. And a small amount of pics in center. Also used black beans and mashed up and place on the fried beans. The group I made this for ask for it again. I love all recipes..........
Our family has been making this for decades, and we love it! Occasionally, I'll add in a thin layer of browned ground beef, but it's not needed at all.
Easy to make, loved it.

Brought this dish to a 4th of July party and everyone loved it. The dish was empty when I brought it home. Didn't add the green onions (don't really care for them) and left the olives on the side in case some didn't like it and all went well! Going in my cookbook for sure!
Doubled the recipe. Will make this again and again!

A favorite at several family potlucks. I always use a good organic brand of refried beans.. Also made my own taco seasoning and just mix with sour cream, which cuts down on sodium. Everyone always asks for my recipe!
Really easy to make. Tastes great.

My 7 layered dip always lacked in taste and creaminess. It never tasted like my friend's. Then I found out the secret ingredient was mayo! It gives the sour cream and taco seasoning mixture a richer, creamier consistency. Now I only make this version. And I increase my mayo to 1/2 cup. Everyone loves and raves about this dip. DO NOT OMIT THE MAYO...you will be disappointed!
Delicious - everybody loved it. I added an 8th layer of chopped cilantro (about 1/4 c.) to the top.

It is great but I would definitely make some changes. The taco seasoning would be omitted. It has a strong taco taste in the sour cream. I prefer the sour cream taste instead. I also didn't use the mayo and added chopped fresh cilantro on the top.
Same as I remember from neighborhood pool parties! Added some chopped cilantro too. Yummy!
Everyone loves this. I substitute salsa for guac because I always have it on hand and it's cheap. I love that it is also no-cook.
We love this dip! I skip the mayo and use jalapenos instead of olives. It's always been a big hit when I bring it to a party.
This was a great recipe. I didn't use the mayo or green onions. I also added dry ranch dressing mix to the sour cream and used homemade taco seasoning. Super easy and tasty!
I make this every time we have a pot luck at work and it always a hit! Great recipe.
Great recipe!! I made a dairy free version and it was very yummy! I also added diced jalapenos for an added kick.

Yum! Having tried other similar dips I was expecting yummy goodness but not to the level that this recipe delivers. Seasoning the sour cream takes it up a notch and has made this my go-to recipe for layered dips. The entire family loved it!

It didn't get completely consumed at the appetizer party, but hubby and I had no trouble finishing it over the next several days. The flavours were very compatible, but a little understated. I reduced the taco seasoning after reading the reviews, but I will try the full amount next time. I also added a layer of mild and shredded iceberg lettuce which added some crunch and stayed surprisingly fresh for several days. Next time I will try a spicier salsa. See my modifications under Other Versions.
Great recipe! I did not use the mayo either and I added a pound of cooked burger. My family actually likes this layered in tostada shells and served for dinner.
Perfection! Had almost everything already on-hand - easy to whip up and was a treat to eat!

This dip is always a hit! I have made this several times and usually double recipe when I make it for big parties. I found that the dip tastes just as great without the mayo. I don't take exact measurements of the cheese, tomatoes, green onions, and olives and just eyeball the amounts to my liking.

Awesome dip that is always the first to go. Hubs and I keep catching each other sneaking into the fridge with a tortilla chip to have "one last bite".... LOL! Made it this time without the black olives (didn't have any), but did not miss them and avoided the extra fat. Like many other reviewers, I used lite sour cream, fat free refried beans and left out the mayo; therefore we avoided all that extra fat as well. Super dip that is still scrumptious in a low fat version.
Simply delish!
We loved it! We left out the mayo and olives, only because I have some olive haters in the family. Great dip! This recipe is quick, simple, and delicious.

As written, it was really good. A definite crowd pleaser.

I made this with homemade salsa in place of the tomatoes and added my own taco seasoning to fat free sour cream, and left out the mayo. Even better. 5 stars!
This is a great dip to enjoy as a family or group gatherings. We love it because we know it is something we can take to a gathering that is gluten free.

I made this for a party and it was a big hit! It is the best nacho dip I have ever had. I used the “Refried Beans Without the Refry” recipe from this site as well as the ” Guacamole” by Bob Cody and the “Taco Seasoning I” recipe. All these together created a dynamite nacho dip! I served the olives on the side as not everybody likes olives.

Replaced mayonnaise with 1 cup (8 oz) sour cream. Since I used a deep dish pie pan increased a few of the ingredients: 1 cup sour cream, 2 tomatoes, 1 cup sliced black olives and 1 cup sliced green onion. Otherwise this recipe is great and my dinner group loved it. DONEIL

Super easy and quick to throw together. I had no mayo so I left it out...didn't miss it, it was great this way. Other changes I made were to stir in a bit of salsa into the refried beans so they weren't so 'stiff' and I also sprinkled the top with a bit of chopped fresh cilantro. This was a hit!
Easy and Delicious! I served this at superbowl and received many compliments :)
Amazing! I used greek yogurt instead of mayo.
Very good, I added lettuce. Bad mistake. Made it very watery.
To those of you who don't love the mayo (which seems to be a lot of you) I have always made this with cream cheese. Just substitute the same amount of cream cheese for the mayo, and it's awesome! :)
Made this for a get together with my kids over the weekend.It was awesome!Didn't last long and plan on making it again very soon.I only used sour cream and no mayo as other readers suggested.

I made this in a 9x13 and brought it to work...there is nothing left and there is still 2 hours to go !
Very addicting flavor. I used the Quick and Easy Guacamole Recipe in it.
I used 1 1/2 cans of black beans instead of refried. Huge tailgate hit.
Very popular appetizer for potluck. Easy to gather around the table, snack a bit, and chat.
I make it over and over. I make it without olives, just because I don't care for them. Everyone loves it!
This is even better if you use a can of Frito-Lay bean dip instead of plain refried beans.
Nowhere does it mention the size of serving dish necessary. Making for the 1st time, too much ingredients for size of serving dish. Sadly, had to start all over.

Love it. I could not find refried beans so I took a can of red kidney beans mashed them up, graded half a onion, chopped up one jalapeno and aded half a cube of vetagable stock dissolved in a little bit of hot water. Put the mixture in a hot pan and cook out all the water but not too dry. This is a bit more effort but worth it!
I made this for a house party and it was good! I really liked the mayo/sour cream mix - I ended up dipping tortilla chips in the leftovers. But in the layer dip I would prefer just plain sour cream.
Add a layer of salsa after the sour cream mixture!!
This looks to be an exceptional dish.Haven't made it yet but I will.Thanks yall.

Delicious! But while I love mayonnaise, I do leave it out of this recipe. I just don't think it's necessary on any level within this dish. This is such an easy dish to take to pot lucks. Throw this together, take along a bag of tortilla chips and you're good to go!
this is a favorite of mine also, however, I put the cheese on last and then put it under the broiler or a real hot oven 450+ just to melt the cheese and make it bubbly..it is really good..
This is the best recipe I've made and I have tried a lot! Thank you. Family favorite!

My version leaves the Mayo out, but I mix about a quarter packet of taco seasoning with the beans before putting first layer down. I have people that don't like tomatoes so I put a thin layer of Pace Medium salsa on beans. I also chop cilantro and sprinkle that on top. Cilantro really adds to the flavor!

Good recipe. There are several versions and I think most people make it to their own taste. I personally don't care for packaged Taco Seasoning so I make my own, omit the mayo, use refried black beans as opposed to Pinto beans and I thinly slice pickled jalapenos on top. The other change I make is that I spead a thin layer of good quality salsa over the beans.
It's an attractive tasty dip that always is the first to go at a party!

I have another recipe that I use with ground beef. However, I needed one that did not use any type of meat because some of my relatives are vegetarians. I also had to changed the sour cream to tofu sour cream. It worked out beautifully. This is a great recipe!.
Quick, easy and delicious.

First of all, let me be up front that I did not add the mayo to this recipe. I didn't really care for this, though. I thought the taco seasoning way overpowered the other flavors and the smoothness of the sour cream. If I made it again, I would do it without the taco seasoning or with maybe 1/2 packet. I made it in an 11x7 pan and that seemed to be the perfect size. It was quick and easy to make and made for an attractive presentation. Other people at the party really liked it but I would not eat it again as is.
A perfect recipe. I made this for a party and everyone loved it and asked for the recipe.

Followed to the letter EXCEPT I left out the mayo because I just didn't think it belonged in this dish. I must say this was delicious and so easy. My boyfriend raved and said it was the best 7-layer he's ever had because of the taco seasoning in the beans and sour cream. This is coming with me to the next party I go to. Thanks so much.

This the best 7 layer taco dip recipe I have found. addidtion of the taco seasoning mix to the sour cream/mayo mixture really makes it. I would also recommend that you make homemade guacamole as well.
Awesome! I used low fat yogurt instead of mayo and this turned out wonderful!!! It fit perfectly in a 8x8 pyrex dish.

Made it just as directed and it's very tasty. I was worried about the sour cream/mayo mix because of the reviews, but I gave it a go and it adds a great "zest" of flavor. Very easy and inexpensive to make. Served them with scoop chips.
Delicious!!! Thanks for sharing!
Awesome!
Been making this for years. Its always the first thing gone. Highly recommend this one.
Without a doubt the best seven layer dip EVER. The taco seasoning mixed with the sour cream and mayonnaise mix really makes this dish stand out!
Love this recipe! I skip the olives, personal preference and if I know I'm feeding a crowd and it will all go without leftovers I add some chopped lettuce. Yum!
Loved it, I did not have enough sour cream so I used half cream cheese and half sour cream.
Was afraid my picky eaters wouldn't like this, but surprisingly it was a big hit. Definitely will be making it again.
This is fantastic. I omitted the mayo too as several others posted.
great dip not much deferrence in taste without the guacamole

I've had several versions of this dip, I think this is the best one yet. I made four pans, which didn't take too long. My co-workers polished off the first one by the time I had the others made. It got rave reviews from everyone. Perfect as it is written.

This was an interesting take on seven layer dip. I was a little skeptical of the mayo/sour cream mix, but it adds a bit of a spicy kick to an otherwise boring seven layer dip. I took it to a pot luck and it got gobbled up pretty quickly.

made this dip for my sons party. it was good, but i could taste the mayo, which isnt a good taste when thinking mexican dip. like i said, it was good, but ill look for an alternative to the mayo concoction.

This is a great dip. I took it to a 4th of July party and everyone enjoyed it. I used vegetarian refried beans, light mayo and sour cream, and 2% sharp cheddar cheese. You won't be disappointed in this recipe - yummo!
